title: Return Policy
text:
I. General Provisions

1.1. This document regulates the procedure for submitting and handling complaints (hereinafter referred to as "Complaint") by buyers of products from the CapyCanna online store, managed by Three Whales s.r.o., IČO: 19925468, registered address: Lidická 700/19, Veveří, 602 00 Brno, Czech Republic (hereinafter referred to as the "Seller").

1.2. All rights and obligations of the parties related to complaints are governed by this document, as well as by the laws of the Czech Republic, including Act No. 89/2012 Coll. (Civil Code) and Act No. 634/1992 Coll. (Consumer Protection Act), as amended.

1.3. The buyer has the right to request this document in written form, and the Seller undertakes to provide it upon request.

II. Exemption from Seller’s Liability for Defects

2.1. The Seller is not liable for defects in the following cases:

  • If the defect was known to the Buyer at the time of purchase and a discount was agreed upon for it.
  • If the defect arises from normal wear and tear due to usage.
  • If the product is used, and the defect corresponds to the degree of wear expected for such a condition.
  • If the defect arises from improper use, storage, interference by the Buyer, or mechanical damage.
  • If the defect is caused by external factors beyond the Seller’s control.

III. Submitting a Complaint

3.1. A complaint may be submitted:

  • At any business location of the Seller where complaints related to the type of goods sold can be accepted.
  • At the official office or business premises of the Seller.
  • Through the contact form on the website or via email: help@capycanna.com.

3.2. The Buyer must prove the right to submit a complaint by providing a receipt, warranty card, or other reliable document confirming the purchase.

3.3. If the complaint concerns a large or difficult-to-transport item, the Seller may evaluate the defect on-site or by other means as agreed with the Buyer. The Buyer is required to cooperate in this process.

IV. Timeframes for Submitting and Processing Complaints

4.1. The Buyer is entitled to submit a complaint about defects discovered within 24 months of receiving the product. For used goods, this period is reduced to 12 months, which the Seller must inform the Buyer about at the time of purchase.

4.2. The Buyer must report the defect without undue delay after discovering it.

4.3. If the defect is remedied by repair, the complaint period is suspended for the duration of the repair.

4.4. In the case of product replacement, a new complaint period does not commence.

4.5. If the product has an expiration date indicated on its packaging or documentation, the complaint must be submitted within this period.

V. Complaint Handling Procedure

5.1. The Seller will decide on the complaint within three business days. This period does not include the time necessary for an expert assessment of the defect.

5.2. The Seller must resolve the complaint, including defect removal, within 30 days of its submission unless a longer period is agreed upon by the parties.

5.3. The Seller provides the Buyer with a written confirmation containing:

  • The date and location of the complaint submission.
  • Characteristics of the defect.
  • The chosen method of resolving the complaint.
  • The timeframe for resolving the complaint.

5.4. The Buyer is obligated to collect the product after the complaint has been resolved. If the product is not collected within 30 days, the Seller has the right to charge storage fees.

VI. Quality at the Time of Receipt

6.1. The Seller guarantees that the delivered goods comply with § 2161 of the Civil Code, specifically:

  • The goods have characteristics agreed upon by the parties.
  • They are suitable for the declared purpose or the usual purpose for such goods.
  • They are supplied in the appropriate quantity and quality.

6.2. If the goods do not meet the specified requirements, the Buyer has the right to:

  • Replacement of the goods.
  • Free removal of the defect.
  • A reasonable discount.
  • Withdrawal from the contract and a refund (in the case of a significant defect).

VII. Liability for Defects

7.1. A defect is considered significant if the Buyer would not have entered into the contract had they known about the defect.

7.2. In the case of a significant defect, the Buyer may choose:

  • Replacement of the goods.
  • Repair.
  • Withdrawal from the contract.
  • A price discount.

7.3. For minor defects, the Buyer may only request removal of the defect or a discount.

VIII. Withdrawal from the Consumer Contract

8.1. When entering into a contract remotely, the consumer has the right to withdraw from the contract without giving a reason within 14 days of receiving the goods. If the contract involves multiple items or partial deliveries, the period begins from the receipt of the last item.

8.2. The consumer must notify the Seller of the withdrawal in writing via email at help@capycanna.com or at the registered address of Three Whales s.r.o. The Seller must confirm receipt of the withdrawal notice without undue delay.

8.3. Upon withdrawal, the Seller will refund all received payments, including delivery costs, no later than 14 days after receiving the withdrawal notice. Refunds will be made using the same payment method unless otherwise agreed.

8.4. The consumer must return the goods to the Seller no later than 14 days after notifying the Seller of the withdrawal. The goods must be returned in their original packaging, undamaged, and with all accessories.

8.5. The consumer is responsible for any reduction in the value of the goods due to handling beyond what is necessary to determine their nature and functionality.

8.6. Exceptions to the right of withdrawal include:

  • Custom-made goods.
  • Perishable goods or goods with an expired shelf life.
  • Sealed goods that cannot be returned for hygiene reasons once opened.

IX. Warranty and Consumer Rights

9.1. The Seller guarantees that the goods comply with the contract terms, declared characteristics, and standards.

9.2. The Buyer has the right to claim defects discovered within 24 months of receiving the goods. This does not apply to goods sold at a discount due to defects or defects caused by normal wear and tear.

9.3. The Buyer must notify the Seller of the defect without delay and provide the goods for inspection.

9.4. Potential solutions for confirmed defects include:

  • Repair of the goods.
  • Replacement of the goods or parts thereof.
  • A reasonable discount.
  • Withdrawal from the contract and a refund.

9.5. If the defect is not confirmed, the Seller has the right to recover expenses incurred for the inspection.

X. Dispute Resolution and Compensation

10.1. If the complaint is deemed justified, the Buyer is entitled to reimbursement of reasonable expenses incurred in submitting the complaint.

10.2. If the Seller rejects the complaint, the Buyer has the right to seek an independent expert evaluation of the defect.

10.3. Disputes that cannot be resolved amicably may be addressed through alternative dispute resolution mechanisms or a competent court.

This policy is effective as of January 1, 2025.
